text: so in 1755 phillip lasser was found at
the ground fireplace
burn beyond recognition
while the state was dismantled and
scattered throughout southern england
one of the family's stewards claimed to
see philip reflected in the mirror an
allegation apparently taken seriously
enough to warn a church investigation
into the house the glass thereafter
known as the lasser glass is sold in
public auction in 1758
the next known owner is an american
railroad tycoon named robert clancy
clancy apparently weighed over 300
pounds in fact while attending
university in connecticut he was known
as the southwind whale he hung the glass
in his ballroom in atlanta
later that year robert clancy is
photographed by a local newspaper and uh
well he's dropped a few pounds
his o-bit was printed a few weeks later
doesn't list a cause of death
unfortunately he and his estate and the
glass are presumably destroyed in
sherman's march of the ocean in 1865.
and after that
glass is lost
until it resurfaces in turn of the
century new england
the next case of note is mary o'connor
1904 she hung the mirror in her private
bathroom two weeks later her niece
beatrice finds mary dead in a bathtub
now the official coroner's report lists
the cause of death as get this
dehydration
the woman died of thirst while soaking
in a full tub for three days the next
case of note is al's card in lake geneva
wisconsin 1943 neighbors reported
hearing screams and loud bags from the
house
the police found the children drowned in
a log cistern
else herself is in the nursery and both
of her legs are completely shattered her
left arm is broken in four places and
six of her ribs are crushed
in her right hand is the large hammer
she's been using to break her own bones
and they find her just she's going to
work on her skull
her right arm though is completely
unharmed
because she needed it
to wield a hammer
alice later said she believed she was
tucking the children into their bed so
she sealed them in the cistern she never
recovers from her injuries and oh the
family kept several dogs at the farm
including an australian shepherd for the
children
